website_summaries.verdict: A reasonably priced model by a quality brand. While others are more aerodynamic and spacious, they can't beat this model's value.
pros: A mid-sized hard-shell cargo box with 8 cu
Secures nicely once assembled and resists leaks
cons: The build isn't quite as solid as costlier models in its class, and it's difficult to assemble

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP REQUESTED REFUND IMMEDIATELY
customer_reviews.text: The shipping box arrived unscathed. Everything looked brand new as it should. Then during assembly, I noticed two holes weren't drilled out. So simple fix right? I finished putting it together and wondered why it would not open/close too well. I noticed a rivet missing and found it in the box. It's not that I can't fix it but for this price ehhh it should be a quality product. Doesn't secure well and water will get in. Just got this thing like 2 hours ago. Already requested a refund. First and final Thule product. In the pictures I have the side with the rivet missing and the other with them secured.
customer_reviews.author: GP7707

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Let’s get the only con out of the way with this roof top carrier- putting it together is a pain BUT having an extra set of hands to help you will make it a breeze. This is an ideal carrier for a small vehicle think fit , fiesta , focus , civic , golf , gti . I took it on a camping trip and easily fit lots of gear and kept it dry through some hard rain. I did have to drill mounting holes in the back but that is easily done .
customer_reviews.author: jose Giron

customer_reviews.title: Great for car trips!
customer_reviews.text: This baby went all the way from California to Montana in May - through rain, snow, high heat, very high winds, and about a billion bugs. It is lightweight (I can put it on my car and take it off by myself), roomy, and yet sturdy. It also cleaned up very nicely after 5,000 miles. I got the advice (perhaps here on Amazon) to keep heavy items in it to help keep it stable on top of my car, and that seems to have worked well. I'm so glad I bought it and will use it for many years to come. AND I feel cool with it on my car!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Used on a three week road trip
customer_reviews.text: I picked this one up after reading several reviews on other roof top carriers and it certainly does the job. Lightweight but sturdy, opens and closes easily, packs a large duffle bag plus a couple of small gym bag size bags to fill the remaining space. I used it for three weeks on the road with any problems. It did not leak during a few rain storms, road noise is low and not much impact to gas milage. Overall a good carrier for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Will MacG

customer_reviews.title: As an open box deal I was happy with the pricing.
customer_reviews.text: It's just an aerodynamic tote. Why are they so expensive? The plastic is thin and wobbly and the edges could be reenforce to make it sturdy, because it doesn't keep it's shape. The other less expensive one on Amazon is probably a better choice and it has decent reviews. If I didn't have a Thule roof rack and this wasn't an open box deal, I wouldn't have brought it. The other ones on here could fit the Thule roof rack, but it's like buying all the same appliances in your kitchen to match, even though it's not necessary. I definitely would not recommend it at full price.
customer_reviews.author: Megatron Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Wondering why people can't figure this thing out??
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, it took me 20 minutes, ALONE, to put this together. I read through the instructions before I started. I used two pieces of tape to hold in two screws in place to get me going. Install the back hinges first! Don't tighten nuts all the way until everything is in place. Go back with a ratchet and tighten nuts. Seriously people!!! My favorite review is the lady that got inside this like a coffin!! Great box!! Great price!! Installed on a 2018 Honda Odyssey.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Worth the time and money.
customer_reviews.text: The price was fair. Install not too hard, but my cross bars were a different brand, which required drilling new holes to fit the U bolts. Assembly definitely requires a second pair of hands and some patience. Still Not that bad. This is installed on a Kia Soul. Fits good, looks good and gives a bit of extra storage, so the back seat is passenger friendly.
customer_reviews.author: virginia

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend at all. It is not of hard material like I had expected. Very flimsy and difficult to put together. Recommend Yakima Skybox, harder material and secures much better. If you wiggle the lid on this it will just pop off and unlatch. Others can attest to this. Don't let them tell you otherwise. Junk roof carrier.
customer_reviews.author: chawnda sz

customer_reviews.title: Fits Nissan Rogue Sport, Assembly is PIA
customer_reviews.text: Fits our 2017 Rogue Sport well (we installed cross bars already). Feel like it's secure. Once assembly is done, install takes about 10 minutes. Use a ladder. Probably doubles the Rogue Sport's cargo space. Didn't have to drill any extra holes to fit it. Assembly is a pain - not possible without a helper because the top/bottom are shipped un-connected. Also, you have to add the weatherstripping foam (included) yourself. Did I do it right? Will this be waterproof? Who knows!
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Its great but could use some improvement
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st roof box. I had my son to heko me assemble it. All the scratches on the surface was made while assembling this thing I also needed my sons help to mount it on the roof Its really hard to lock It survived the 3.5 hours trip. Performed way. etter than a rooftop bag in terms of aerodynamic
customer_reviews.author: Mr T

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are reasonably clear and assembly with one person is doable
customer_reviews.text: Just got this product today. Was able to assemble it by myself in about 20 or 30 minutes. Only needed a Phillips head screwdriver and a wrench. I used a small socket wrench with a 10 mm and 11 mm head. Hardest part was aligning the top with the bottom to get the hinge attached. All in all I'd give it a four since it was pretty easy but there were a few tough parts. Will update this review when I have a chance to install it on the car.
customer_reviews.author: Janna Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Fits a Kia Soul - excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I actually found this easy to assemble - would have been easier if I had a helper. Fits my Kia Soul - see photo. I did have to drill 4 holes in the carrier to fit the cross bars on the Kia which are not adjustable. But easy to do. Light weight so I was able to place it on top of the Kia with no assistance. Sits securely on the cross bars and opens, closes and locks perfectly. Worth the price. Note to manufacturer: Would have even better if it came preassembled!
customer_reviews.author: 70's TV is the best

customer_reviews.title: Fairly Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this box for my wife's new Jeep Cherokee almost two years ago. The mounting system for this box is just U bolts through the fairly thin plastic of the bottom. On our last trip over the mountains we got a lot of water inside of the box. This box is stored indoors when not in use and I believe it is very well taken care of. I would highly recommend spending a little more money and buying a better quality roof top box that has a better mounting system and I would not buy Thule products in the future if this is the quality they produce.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Norseman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and install
customer_reviews.text: I use it somewhat unconventionally on my Jeep but the size and the Thule brand are what lead me to buy it. Its easy to assemble and a lot easier with some help. Takes less than 15 minutes with a third and and requires just a few simple hand tools. In it I have 3 tables; 2 chairs; 2 trekking poles and a 130 square foot 6 man tent. All furniture of the camping variety of course and it fits nice and neat and locks up tight. I've put about 3500 miles and 9 states on it and it has performed perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made and worth the money
customer_reviews.text: For my usage this box works perfectly. It was fairly easy to put together but you will need a second person. The box feels very sturdy and the hinges feel as if they’ll last for some time. Is this their high end $1,500 box? No. But it’s not meant to be. Will it last? I use mine for serious off roading and so far it’s held up like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Bramley

customer_reviews.title: For us it was excellent. Took it on a 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Was surprised by this. Read some reviews on line that indicated some problems. For us it was excellent. Took it on a 1 month, 700 mile trip. It did not leak, it did not make loud noises. Did not take it off the roof for a month. It was fine. It is an 8 cu ft unit, it is not extra large but it did exactly what we expected it to do.
customer_reviews.author: David F.

customer_reviews.title: It's OK, I suppose
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't latch tight. Lock cores are not replaceable. Sturdy enough, though and doesn't rattle if you throw a ratchet strap around it it. Just seems like a heck of a lot of money for a plastic box. At the end of the day, it gets the job done. I had to drill extra holes in it to accommodate a Honda Odyssey rail spacing.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Stehno

customer_reviews.title: Roomy.
customer_reviews.text: I managed to pack quite a few light bulky items. Assembly was a little hard even with my wife giving me a hand. Do not attempt assembly by yourself. Installation was an easier one-person job. Luckily my crossbars were already at the right placement.
customer_reviews.author: Jim F

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty flimsy for the price. I really expected it to be twice as thick and fairly rigid at this price point. I don’t think it’s even 1/8” thick. Will see how it stands up :-/
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyCache

customer_reviews.title: Missing screw caps
customer_reviews.text: Have owned Thule cargo boxes in the past and thought this small one would be similar in quality yet just smaller. In actuality, it's considerably less solid. The plastic is thinner, and the parts overall seem cheap. It also arrived with missing screw cap covers. For this price point, would expect more from Thule.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Having downgraded from a full-sized SUV to a smaller one, I definitely miss the extra trunk space for longer trips. This cargo box helped and was secure. I am regretting buying this smaller one as the shape inside makes it tough to put very much in it, but that is my fault not the product. I would buy from this manufacturer again, just a bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: vanilla latte

customer_reviews.title: some issues mostly self imposed
customer_reviews.text: When I put some fishing equipment in the cargo box the bottom bulged down so I put a piece of plywood to support things in it and the cargo box did not fit for my car but after drilling a couple of holes it fit fine. I had to order another set of locks to replace the poor screw that wouldn't allow the nut to screw on it properly. Now that all is adjusted I like it and it hasn't reduced my gas mileage and it is still on tight so I am now happy.
customer_reviews.author: William Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Pretty inexpensive, pretty eary, pretty durable
customer_reviews.text: Not the easiest thing to put together. Easy to install once assembled, pretty inexpensive compared to other brands. Cons -Not super water tight. It's fine, but not impermeable, and the sticker 'seals' for unused holes are worthless, electrical tape it better -Big all the time. Great when it's on the vehicle, a pain when you have to store it afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Sad Dave

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, good value
customer_reviews.text: You need 2 people to assemble this. The kit was short a screw, but Thule sent me a new bag of parts. Excellent service.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Mooney, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Did not keep out rain
customer_reviews.text: Used this carrier on a trip across Kansas. After driving through a thunderstorm, we found 1.5 cups of water in the carrier after the storm--it was dry inside beforehand. Poor design, and inadequate weatherstripping had been provided. Recommend against purchasing this carrier. But Amazon accepted it as a return--thanks, Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Anders S Tune

customer_reviews.title: Good Cargo box
customer_reviews.text: We just bought this one and it worked well for our needs. Easy to put together and install. I was a little surprised at how thin the material was but it did the job. We took it on a 1600 mile trip with almost no issues but I will warn people to make sure both locks are engaged tightly. I thought I had them both locked good but at our first stop I noticed the front one came unhooked from the latch. I relocked it and never had another problem so maybe user error but just a warning.
customer_reviews.author: Tom W.

customer_reviews.title: broken parts
customer_reviews.text: The problem is that it came with one of the lid's support arms cracked. What is upsetting is that its obviously broken, all other parts are brand new and still in the package. For me, it's not easy to return something this large- not to mention it's time-sensitive my family needed this carrier. We waited a long time for it now must send it back and wait again... unless they will send me the replacement part.. most likely I will buy the part because its easier than depending on amazon and Thule to get it right.
customer_reviews.author: jesse bercowetz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Couple thousand miles, high winds, heavy rains.... dry clothes!!!! NO PROBLEMS!!! NO ROAD NOISE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Lange

customer_reviews.title: Great Box for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: This box is perfect for a weekend or even vacation getaway. It is not as sturdy as other boxes, but you get what you pay for. It needed assembly; this was relatively simple - two people work better than one as it is necessary to have a helper hold the box while being put together. The box easily clamps onto my Subaru cross bars. And it is so light that anyone should be able to get it on top with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy H.

customer_reviews.title: 10 years and still no issues
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 10 years ago and used it for... you name it. Fits tons of stuff but now we need something little bigger. I like the fact that it opens on the side versus newer designs have a rear opening which can be problematic for some.
customer_reviews.author: J. L

customer_reviews.title: Overall happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: It was definitely a two person job to put it together. I also had 1problem installing it. The predrilled hole in the correct position to fit on my car rack was not predrilled. Of course I didn’t notice until the other 4 brackets were already installed. All that being said I was very pleased with the surprising amount of stuff it can hold and the fact that I couldn’t hear or feel it while driving. It was exactly what I needed to take 7 basketball players and the gear 250 miles to a tournament.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and lockable.
customer_reviews.text: I use the cargo box to store the extras that I won't need until I have arrived at my destination, such as camping gear. It is easy to install on my Buick Enclave roof rack and I can leave it on until I am ready to store it back in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Rolf A.

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good
customer_reviews.text: The instructions for putting it together are some of the best I have seen in years. Generally, it went together well. One bolt had a deformed head but it was a pretty common size and I had one just like it in my workshop. The locks do not seem to work too well even if you adjust it like the instructions say. I bought a belt to put around the box because I do not trust the locks. I recall that Amazon stated that many people who bought the Cargo Box also bought a belt. I understand why.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Rulapaugh

customer_reviews.title: drove 1400 miles with it, part of it through the polar vortex cold snap.
customer_reviews.text: The sidekick did not become brittle or tear (as I fear). was watertight as advertised. Very useful. assembling it was a pain because the box was constructed of flexible plastic. No warning were given about over tightening the screws, so I guess they are not concerned about over tightening. The four bracket fit my factory installed aerodynamic cross bars (Lexus"s). Happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Minn Thant

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased!
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It didn't feel that sturdy until I installed it on my car. Once assembled its simple to install. I didn't have help so I had arms all over to hold one screw while tightning on the other side of the top. But, Im so glad I bought it and have enjoyed it since.
customer_reviews.author: Amy T

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Car Top
customer_reviews.text: My kids call me the "car top guy"....I have one on our mini van, a bed version for my truck and recently had to move from Utah to Seattle, this carrier is AWESOME. The only reason for a (3) star on assembly is because it would have been WAY easier with two people. This carrier holds ALOT, was completely weather tight and looks cool as well.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Horton

customer_reviews.title: Useful!
customer_reviews.text: Useful on our Toyota Rav 4 with manufacturer installed roof rack. Only takes up part of the rooftop and holds up to 70 lbs which is good for lightweight bulky items. Easy assembly and easy to attach. Took us through downpours in TN and hot dry desert.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedeeez

customer_reviews.title: Nice Entry Level Cargo Box
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this cargo box so far but have not taken any long trips yet. One person can get this assembled if you have long arms and are flexible. It was not too challenging but took a bit of time to get everything lined up properly. I was not able to get the locks aligned to function properly without adding some pressure and that seems to make the fit more snug which seems good.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Hickman

customer_reviews.title: Good cargo box for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great box for on top of Winnebago View motorhome. Can fit over 3 bundles of fire wood, two chairs, axe and collapsible slat table. Not the highest quality but does the job at good price. No issues with hinges, locks etc. mounting was easy. Works great for my application.
customer_reviews.author: Ramble Tamble

customer_reviews.title: Engineers vs. Technicians!
customer_reviews.text: I thought that it would be heftier, but it did the job. It is lite and we got god mileage with it. I had to drill more holes to fit onto my Outlander and I wrapped the screw supports to protect the cross bars. Also, the 2 large screws did not fit into the plastic supports, so I had to buy 2 screws at the local chain hardware store. It wasn't easy finding a suitable substitute. Now, I like the finished product. I think that the company should proof their kit better; you have to assemble the whole thing yourself.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN B M MASTERS

customer_reviews.title: Great for cargo and offseason storage
customer_reviews.text: This was cheaper than renting one every summer and it is a great storage bin for the camping gear that nobody knows where to store it. I lived in California at the time so no snow adventures with it. Make sure to have the Thule brand rack.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Small for price
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t like attaching to roof rack Thought it had tightening screw not U screws
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you need something else on the roof
customer_reviews.text: This thing is about half the width of my roof so I can mount a rod case or kayak on the other side. Light too. Assembly reasonable. Only open on one side so be aware, looks silly backwards. Will hold a deflated float tube and a small child. Kidding about the kid.
customer_reviews.author: dentalboy

customer_reviews.title: Did very well cross country in snow & rain
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to use. Durable and secure. We had heavy rain over several days of our trip and hit a snow storm & freezing temps on the road home. No cracks or leaks! Very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice,  little on the small side
customer_reviews.text: Showed up a little banged up. And the sticker on it was places crooked, being a Sweden product i expected a little more attention to detail. Kinda disappointed for the money spent
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: This product has more room than one would think based on outward appearance. It felt strong and there were no issues in our road trip from Miami to New York. Great product from Thule.
customer_reviews.author: J.A.C.U.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought right before a trip to the beach and LOVE it! Although it looks tiny on the top of my Tahoe,it saved me so much room that the trip and packing was a breeze for me, my wife, our 4 year old and our 5 month old. This was for a week vacation! Love it
customer_reviews.author: Alfred W.

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy
customer_reviews.text: One of the locks will not lock and the screw plastic cover pieces so not snap on.
customer_reviews.author: donnie puckett

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t come with locks or directions
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this on PRIME to come in for our camping trip and it came in on time but it didn’t have directions, bolts, locks or brackets with it. It is the perfect size for a weekend trip but can’t install it on time so we had to repack.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel accessorie
customer_reviews.text: It worked perfectly. I mounted it on top of my RAV 4 and it held my golf clubs and accessories perfect. No wind resistance or noise. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lennard R Dillon

customer_reviews.title: May need adjustment.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. On my 2017 Outback, the predrilled holes didn’t exactly line up to work with my rack. I drilled two sets of to line up with the rear rack crossbar. Worked great on a 2000+ mile road trip.
customer_reviews.author: B. Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts that I would like this on my car..I have a Mazda 3 hatchback and it looks good and doesn't change how my car handled...Only problem was when we hit 100 mph winds and then I could feel the wind pushing it but that was extreme...holds alot of stuff. Would buy again, if I lost this one.
customer_reviews.author: nikki l mann

customer_reviews.title: Thule Rooftop Cargo Box
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I saw this Rooftop Cargo box on lots of cars, I loved the look and wanted to buy it for my daughter's birthday in October. I was insured of a 2 day arrival, but it arrived one day later. However when we opened it, the carrier proved to be all that I expected and when I gave it to my daughter, she was thrilled. She has installed it, without problem, and thanks me over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling.
customer_reviews.text: Did exactly what I needed it to do. Get a second pair of hands to help you put it together. It's very lightweight. Still a little awkward for one person to put on top of the vehicle, but I'm only 120 lbs and I am able to get it up there! We went through rain and everything inside was dry as a bone.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS!!! We bought this to use for our camping trips. Absolutely love it. Very sturdy and easy to put together. Great brand. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amberlina

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Can’t wait for s cross country trip. Light. Easy to handle. Wish the bottom came lined tho. I did line it.
customer_reviews.author: Ea

customer_reviews.title: Was hard covered and a great product.
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a Thule cargo box years ago. Was hard covered and a great product.. Sad to day I lost it in my divorce. Buying this one was a bit of a disappointment. The top cover is very flimsy, and a little distorted. It did the job on my trip from PA to Florida but NOT worth the 300.00 and change I paid for it... Guess I paid for the name this time around.
customer_reviews.author: James Evers

customer_reviews.title: Hard to assemble. Flimsy. It's just ok...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely flimsy. I sure hope it doesn't fly off my roof. VERY difficult to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: I am sure it stated dimensions, but we were ...
customer_reviews.text: I am sure it stated dimensions, but we were surprised how little it held and how narrow it was. Only small carry on size bags fit into it for our vacation. It appears to be made well though.
customer_reviews.author: SSilhan

customer_reviews.title: Worked as spcified - a little expensive
customer_reviews.text: Used for move from AZ to MI. Wasn't difficult to assemble with one other person to assist. I think it's a little expensive for what it is, but there aren't a lot of choices.
customer_reviews.author: M. Yates

customer_reviews.title: did the trick, but was tricky to put together
customer_reviews.text: this carrier was a challenge to put together, even tho the product description says otherwise. it took my husband (who is very good with directions and is handy with the tool box) about an hour to put together and install on the roof of our Subaru Outback. once the carrier was in place i was quite skeptical as to how much we'd actually be able to fit in it--the carrier looks so small. thankfully we could stow our toddler's pack-n-play, our maclaren techno xt stroller, toys, a beach umbrella in addition to a few other things, freeing up room in said Outback to fit said toddler and her 13-year-old sister in the backseat! thank you, Thule!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Clawson

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck!!!
customer_reviews.text: Took this cargo box on a 1500-mile roundtrip and it worked great. No issues...
customer_reviews.author: Alfred M. Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Good box with slightly difficult assembly
customer_reviews.text: The assembly is a little bit difficult and requires two people. Installation on top of the car is extremely easy and can be done in 5-10 min by one person. We took this box on a very long trip and were very happy with it. It rained a good amount, but all of our stuff remained dry.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy to assemble and install, and perfect size for a small sedan. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: jmsbnd0071

customer_reviews.title: Water tight easy way to carry extra items
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip back east from California. It survived the torrential rain preceding the tornados and flooding of Iowa, Kansas and Illinois with maybe 3 drops of water inside. Travelled so well could not even feel it on the roof. Very economical way to carry those extra items. Relatively easy to assemble and installed on the roof of my Escape very easily. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: hoffdog

customer_reviews.title: Good cargo carrier
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared to have two persons to put the cargo box together. It definitely would not be easy for one person. All in all, we love the carrier!
customer_reviews.author: Sue B

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Clunky and bad design for the actual mounting to the roof bars. It uses two nuts and what looks like a kitchen cabinet pull, so you have to be above and below the box at the same time to mount it. That's obviously tricky for one person to accomplish.
customer_reviews.author: Cali

customer_reviews.title: So glad to have the storage!
customer_reviews.text: Love having this storage so we don't have to crowd the dogs in the car with our travel gear.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Reider

customer_reviews.title: Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and great packaging. Had to drill a few holes through the plastic to make it fit with my factory installed roof rack, but it was very easy. Drove 7 hours and back with no issues...Great find on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: We used this for our trip that was just over ...
customer_reviews.text: We used this for our trip that was just over 2,500 miles total and it worked without problems. Kept everything dry when it rained and we were never worried about it falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: JKingsley

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a cargo box
customer_reviews.text: This item was fairly easy to assemble. Would have been easier with 2 people but I put it together in less than 30 minutes by myself. It was easy to mount onto the roof rack as well. Bought this for a my family beach trip and will help with the overflow of stuff we will bring with us.
customer_reviews.author: brucelee1968

customer_reviews.title: No noise
customer_reviews.text: Car road so well that we forgot it was there!
customer_reviews.author: Cherise L. Spellman

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose- wish it were a little sturdier
customer_reviews.text: This cargo box is perfect for road trips and holding extra gear. It’s not huge, so we leave it on our car and use it all the time. I docked a star because it would be nice if the plastic and metal hinges were a little sturdier, but for the price, I’d still buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Bisset

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Used carrier for a cross country trip. It was great and kept all items dry through terrible weather.
customer_reviews.author: jean

customer_reviews.title: Great budget cargo box
customer_reviews.text: Great budget cargo box. Much cheaper than others I've looked at, but this one holds a lot, is easy to install, and doesn't leak. We've taken it on several trips and never had an issue with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Easy to work with.
customer_reviews.text: Not the most room. But enough. It closes well and seals tight.
customer_reviews.author: jthebear

customer_reviews.title: sidekick performed well
customer_reviews.text: The sidekick assembled easily. It is very light and easy to install on th roof of my VW Tiguan. A little bit flimsy but very usable. I have taken it on a 1000 mile trip with no issues. Gas mileage is about 1 mpg less than normal, not much of a sacrifice for the added storage. I would recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: NCpups

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: This product is very nice. It did come with a big scratch on top. I needed it. Didn’t have time to return. Overall I love it perfect fit for my Subaru
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: It's a great box once installed
customer_reviews.text: I put together on my own, it was a huge challenge to say the least. The back lock didn't line up correctly so I had to use cargo straps in addition and then gorilla tape those down. It's a great box once installed. Having two people to assemble makes it much easier, trust me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R Green

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation and good quality. A bit small. 8 cu ft. only gets you so much storage space I suppose. Perfect for a small sedan, but too small for an SUV. The U-bolts will work for smaller sized roof rack bars, but if you have thicker bars the threads will not penetrate through far enough.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B.

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to assemble and is light enough for one person ...
customer_reviews.text: My cargo box was delivered very quickly. It was easy to assemble and is light enough for one person to place on my vehicle. The only hitch was that I had to drill 2 holes at the front so that the mounting brackets could accommodate the roof rails on my 2013 Subaru Outback.
customer_reviews.author: A Scorpio in Nor Cal

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was a great buy for our kia Soul 2017. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: David Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Holds two sets of golf clubs and bags as advertised ...
customer_reviews.text: Holds two sets of golf clubs and bags as advertised. Not much room for any thing else, however, I squeezed in a camp chair. I did have to drill extra holes to make it fit my 2015 Outback. When it is loaded, you may need to giggle it around a little to get the latches to lock.
customer_reviews.author: Norm

customer_reviews.title: Ford Freestar loved the Thule sidekick
customer_reviews.text: Definately took two people to assemble due to just needing some extra hands (and I have a VERY "handy" husband). However, that said, I thought at first it would be too flimsy but it was perfect. East to install, not too expensive, lightweight, came with locks with two sets of keys and arrived in three days from order. It held a large suitcase and a medium rolling case and a duffel bag. Not huge but definately helpful and worth the money, I think. Would definately order from Amazon again and do not regret this product AT ALL.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, until you hit wind.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is just fine until you hit 25 mph + winds. Wind will blow it open even strapped around it. Just beware of that. We had to go as far as take it down and shove it in our car on I70 traveling thru the great wide windy open of western Kansas.
customer_reviews.author: lhoff

customer_reviews.title: but not too bad. Holes too short for stock crossbars on a ...
customer_reviews.text: Assembly a bit of a pain, but not too bad. Holes too short for stock crossbars on a 2011 outback. Drilled two holes, fixed it easily enough.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Stayed Dry
customer_reviews.text: After 1,000 miles in freezing rain, blizzard, and wild winds the gear inside stayed dry. Fit two suitcases, a few coats, shoes, and filler. Putting it together out of box was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Josannah Birman

customer_reviews.title: It works good. Not as large as I thought it would ...
customer_reviews.text: It works good. Not as large as I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Elwin P Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together, lots of space
customer_reviews.text: I love the smaller size of this rooftop cargo box - it doesn't overwhelm the car but still holds a lot of stuff. I put it together and on the car with a girlfriend ... It was easy enough that I could have done it alone. A great travel solution.
customer_reviews.author: DesertReb

customer_reviews.title: Good for Traveling with Golf Clubs
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly what we needed to travel with 2 sets of golf clubs. We have a small SUV and it fit perfectly with room to still see out of the sunroof. If you need more room, you need to get a larger one because it only holds 2 sets of golf clubs with no room for anything else!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Robinson

customer_reviews.title: ... to put this together but once it's together it's fantastic! Worked out perfect for us & our needs
customer_reviews.text: Definitely need 2 people to put this together but once it's together it's fantastic ! Worked out perfect for us & our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Thule 682
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Thule roof top carrier-- I mount two of them side-by-side on a Jeep Cherokee- I have used them to travel the highways and remote regions of NW Canada for thousands of miles and they are superb.
customer_reviews.author: Coyote Frostbite

customer_reviews.title: it's easily removed. We drove to FLORIDA and back (2400 ...
customer_reviews.text: You will read some reviews where the unit "leaked". Here's how to fix that: instead of the stickers they give you to cover the holes you don't need on the bottom (the mounting holes), use RTV silicone sealant. It's water tight, and if you need the holes in the future, it's easily removed. We drove to FLORIDA and back (2400 round trip miles) in (of course) heavy rain at times....hey, its FLORIDA. No leaks. Did well. Yes, you will slightly notice it there with some small noise, but not much.
customer_reviews.author: mlee98

customer_reviews.title: Used once. Capacity is handy but cannot make the ...
customer_reviews.text: Used once. Capacity is handy but cannot make the u-bolts work properly on an Xterra factory installed roof rack. Emailed Thule with suggestions on how to fix problem. Thule customer service was not helpful in solving the problem. Still looking for retrofit to make it work properly.
customer_reviews.author: J.Nytvishn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for vacation
customer_reviews.text: worked perfectly on my sister's Subaru Tribeca. She was able to fit 4 duffel bags in it and a toiletry bag!
customer_reviews.author: LZ

customer_reviews.title: Thin & Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Very thin and flimsy. For the price I would have expected a little better quality. I actually question if this is an authentic Thule??!!!
customer_reviews.author: Savannah walden

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! I bought this and it has survived three ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I bought this and it has survived three summers. I keep it on top of my vehicle all summer long. No leaks and no issues. I love this!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack box
customer_reviews.text: Good size to free up space in the car. It's sturdy and not too loud.
customer_reviews.author: Ibis_1

customer_reviews.title: Dependable Sidekick
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Sidekick for my trusty ultra high mileage 1999 CRV to use for family car camping. The box is no big deal to put together. I tested this thing out on a three night trip to a northern Minnesota State Park. I loaded the box with a giant REI 8 man tent, 2 large tarps, a 2 burner cook stove and 4 camp chairs. I drove through torrential rain at 75mph and did not see a drop of water in box. If you just want some extra storage and don't want to spend big dollars, this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Birchwood

customer_reviews.title: Made our trip more comfortable....
customer_reviews.text: We have a RAV 4 and went on a vacation for 6 days with 4 people. It allowed us to take everything we needed to enjoy the trip. The Thule was the right size for our car and didn't block the sunroof. It was easy to assemble, access and load/unload. The only thing that I wishes it had was a more sturdy body. It was made of a plastic material and seemed like it might be easy to puncture, but the lightness of the Thule did make it easy to put on top of our car....Pam and Dan in Oregon
customer_reviews.author: Pam Kilkenny

product_meta.title: Thule 682 Sidekick Rooftop Cargo Box,Grey, One Size
product_meta.description:
The Thule Side Kick is the smallest rooftop cargo box that Thule makes. This clamshell style box's shape and size make it perfect for carrying golf clubs and camping gear without monopolizing your roof space. The Side Kick is made of impact resistant polyurethane, and keeps your gear safe and secure with the included locks. The Side Kick will mount to almost any rack system, be it Thule, Yakima, or factory. Box Mounting Dimensions: Minimum Spacing - 23 5/8 inches, Maximum Spacing - 28 inches, Mounting Width - 14 3/8 inches, Front Clearance - 36 inches.

AMAZON.COM


 The Thule 682 Sidekick Rooftop Cargo Box is compact roof box tailor-made for small vehicles that need to conserve space. The 682 Sidekick allows for 8 cubic feet or up to 110-lbs of cargo per box makes it ideal for carrying small loads such as camping gear or golf clubs. The box is constructed UV and impact-resistent ABS plastic, ensuring years of durable wear. It is compatible with all Thule base racks, as well as most any aftermarket or factory roof rack, and installs/can be removed from your rack in minutes without the use of tools via the Thule U-bolt/knob mounting system. All the necessary mounting hardware and straps are included, and the unit is covered by a lifetime limited warranty. 

A compact roof box tailor-made for small vehicles that need to conserve space.
View larger. Easy, one-handed access to cargo from the passenger side.
View larger. Easy U-Bolt mounting system allows for use with virtually any rack in minutes.
View larger. Dual single side locking system allows for dependable security.
View larger. GET YOUR GEAR OUT OF THE CAR AND ONTO YOUR ROOF
 Thule's cargo boxes are designed with your active life in mind. Compatible with all Thule rack systems, as well as round bar and most factory racks, they allow you to get your gear out of your car and onto the top of your roof - saving precious interior space, keeping moisture out of your vehicle when hauling snowsport or watersport gear and securing items that would otherwise roll around during transit. They are innovative, built to last, are easy to load and unload and break down quickly and easily when the time comes. Finally, Thule's assortment of rooftop boxes gives you many options to transport your gear safely, easily and in style. Simply choose the one that best fits the length of your vehicle roof and rack and experience the difference they make in your travels. 

INSTALLATION WITH THE U-BOLT MOUNTING SYSTEM
 Installation and/or removal of the Sidekick Rooftop Cargo Box from your rack is easy and fast via Thule's U-Bolt mounting system. This nearly tool-free mounting system allows you to attach your rooftop box to virtually any roof rack in minutes. Each corner of the Sidekick has a series of four pre-bored holes aligned along the length of the box. Included U-Bolt hardware is slid up from the bottom, across the crossbars of your rack and into two of these four holes. Once through, the hardware attaches to one of the four supplied knobs. Simply twist the threaded knob to get a secure hold that you can count on, and easily remove as you please. Also included as part of this system are all the hardware needed. Because of the pre-bored holes, the Sidekick requires a minimum spacing of rack crossbars of 23⅝", and a maximum spacing of 32 1/16". 

SIMPLE USE, STOWAGE AND SECURITY
 Once Thule's Sidekick Rooftop Cargo Box is installed it is extremely easy to use. Easy access to gear is guaranteed with Thule's passenger-side opening system built into the lid of Sidekick that also allows for one-handed usage, with the lid staying in place when opened. Finally, the Sidekick Rooftop Cargo Box provides for the security of your gear via two included locks to secure box contents and lock the box to the carrier. 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
 1-Thule 682 Sidekick Rooftop Cargo Box, 4-U-bolts and brackets, 4-knobs, 2-camlocks with keys, 1-sheet of vinyl hole covers, all necessary additional hardware, 1-user's manual/warranty card. 

KEY FEATURES
 * Passenger-side cargo opening
 * Heavy-duty design protects gear and helps keep out the elements
 * Carries 8 cubic feet or up to 110-lbs of cargo per box
 * Includes 2 locks to secure box contents and lock the box to the carrier
 * Fits Thule rack systems, round bars and most factory racks

TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS
 * Storage - 8 cubic feet or up to 110-lbs of cargo per box
 * Length (in) - 54"
 * Width (in) - 25"
 * Height (in) - 15.5"
 * Weight (lbs) - 16 lbs
 * Mounting System - U-bolt
 * Box Opening - Single-side
 * Locking System - Dual side lock/lock bracket system
 * Capacity - Carries up to 2 sets of golf clubs (not compatible with skis)

LIMITED LIFETIME WARRANTY
 Thule will warranty all Thule brand car rack systems and its accessories manufactured by Thule during the time that an original retail purchaser owns the product. This warranty terminates if a purchaser transfers the product to any other person. No warranty is given for defects caused by normal wear and tear, cosmetic rust, scratches, accidents, unlawful vehicle operation, or modification of, or any types of repair of a load carrier system other than those authorized by Thule. 

ABOUT THULE
 Thule was founded in 1942 by the Thulin family, when Eric Thulen, a true lover of the outdoors, put the Thule name on a pike trap he designed and began to sell in Scandinavia. It wasn't long before he added other practical items to the company's portfolio. By the 1960s, the company began to concentrate on car-related products, including its first roof rack. The Thulin family sold Thule to the publicly listed company Eldon in 1979, and it has continued to grow both organically and through acquisitions ever since. The Thule Group is a world leader in providing transport solutions for an active life.
feature_bullets: Space-saving design carries the load with room for other items on roof rack
Sturdy U-bolts with reinforcement plates mount cargo box securely to the rack
Passenger-side opening for easier loading and unloading
This item requires significant assembly. Refer to installation manual under product details below.
Please check Buyers Guide for vehicle fit information

specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
